Text

ï»¿ [THE INNOCENCE OF FATHER BROWN

The Blue Cross]311-the innocence of father brown the blue cross

Between the silver ribbon of morning and [the green glittering ribbon of sea]312-the green glittering ribbon of sea , [the boat]313-the boat touched [Harwich]1-harwich and let loose [a swarm of folk like flies]314-a swarm of folk like flies , among whom [the man]315-the man [we]316-we must follow was by no means conspicuous - nor wished to be . There was nothing notable about [him]315-the man , except a slight contrast between the holiday gaiety of [his]315-the man clothes and the official gravity of [his]315-the man face . [His]315-the man clothes included a slight , pale grey jacket , a white waistcoat , and a silver straw hat with a grey - blue ribbon . [His]315-the man lean face was dark by contrast , and ended in a curt black beard that looked Spanish and suggested an Elizabethan ruff . [He]315-the man was smoking a cigarette with the seriousness of [an idler]317-an idler . There was nothing about [him]315-the man to indicate the fact that the grey jacket covered a loaded revolver , that the white waistcoat covered a police card , or that the straw hat covered [one of the most powerful intellects in [Europe]2-europe]318-one of the most powerful intellects in europe . For this was [Valentin]110-valentin [himself]110-valentin , [the head of [the Paris police]320-the paris police]319-the head of the paris police and [the most famous investigator of [the world]322-the world]321-the most famous investigator of the world ; and [he]315-the man was coming from [Brussels]3-brussels to [London]4-london to make the greatest arrest of the century .

[Flambeau]111-flambeau was in [England]5-england . [The police of [three countries]324-three countries]323-the police of three countries had tracked [the great criminal]325-the great criminal at last from [Ghent]6-ghent to [Brussels]3-brussels , from [Brussels]3-brussels to [the Hook of [Holland]7-holland]326-the hook of holland ; and it was conjectured that [he]111-flambeau would take some advantage of the unfamiliarity and confusion of the Eucharistic Congress , then taking place in [London]4-london . Probably [he]111-flambeau would travel as [some minor clerk]327-some minor clerk or [secretary connected with it]328-secretary connected with it ; but , of course , [Valentin]110-valentin could not be certain ; [nobody]329-nobody could be certain about [Flambeau]111-flambeau .

It is many years now since this colossus of crime suddenly ceased keeping [the world]322-the world in a turmoil ; and when [he]111-flambeau ceased , as [they]323-the police of three countries said after the death of [Roland]112-roland , there was a great quiet upon [the earth]331-the earth . But in [his]111-flambeau best days [I]0-i mean , of course , [his]111-flambeau worst [Flambeau]111-flambeau was a figure as statuesque and international as [the Kaiser]113-the kaiser . Almost every morning [the daily paper]332-the daily paper announced that [he]111-flambeau had escaped the consequences of one extraordinary crime by committing another . [He]111-flambeau was [a Gascon of gigantic stature and bodily daring]333-a gascon of gigantic stature and bodily daring ; and the wildest tales were told of [his]111-flambeau outbursts of athletic humour ; how [he]111-flambeau turned the juge d'instruction upside down and stood [him]111-flambeau on [his]111-flambeau head , " to clear [his]111-flambeau mind "[111-flambeau] ; how [he]111-flambeau ran down [the Rue de Rivoli]8-the rue de rivoli with [a policeman]334-a policeman under each arm . It is due to [him]111-flambeau to say that [his]111-flambeau fantastic physical strength was generally employed in such bloodless though undignified scenes ; [his]111-flambeau real crimes were chiefly those of ingenious and wholesale robbery . But each of [his]111-flambeau thefts was almost a new sin , and would make a story by itself . It was [he]111-flambeau who ran [the great Tyrolean Dairy Company in [London]4-london]335-the great tyrolean dairy company in london , with [no dairies]336-no dairies , no cows , [no carts]337-no carts , no milk , but with some thousand subscribers . These [he]111-flambeau served by the simple operation of moving the little milk cans outside [people]338-people 's doors to the doors of [[his]111-flambeau own customers]339-his own customers . It was [he]111-flambeau who had kept up an unaccountable and close correspondence with [a young lady whose whole letter - bag]340-a young lady whose whole letter - bag was intercepted , by the extraordinary trick of photographing [his]111-flambeau messages infinitesimally small upon the slides of a microscope . A sweeping simplicity , however , marked many of [his]111-flambeau experiments . It is said that [he]111-flambeau once repainted all the numbers in [a street]341-a street in the dead of night merely to divert [one traveller]342-one traveller into a trap . It is quite certain that [he]111-flambeau invented a portable pillar - box , which [he]111-flambeau put up at corners in [quiet suburbs]343-quiet suburbs on the chance of [strangers]344-strangers dropping postal orders into it . Lastly , [he]111-flambeau was known to be [a startling acrobat]345-a startling acrobat ; despite [his]111-flambeau huge figure , [he]111-flambeau could leap like a grasshopper and melt into the tree - tops like a monkey . Hence [the great Valentin]110-valentin , when [he]110-valentin set out to find [Flambeau]111-flambeau , was perfectly aware that [his]110-valentin adventures would not end when [he]110-valentin had found [him]111-flambeau .

But how was [he]110-valentin to find [him]111-flambeau ? On this the great [Valentin]110-valentin 's ideas were still in process of settlement .

There was one thing which [Flambeau]111-flambeau , with all [his]111-flambeau dexterity of disguise , could not cover , and that was [his]111-flambeau singular height . If [Valentin]110-valentin 's quick eye had caught [a tall apple - woman]346-a tall apple - woman , [a tall grenadier]347-a tall grenadier , or even [a tolerably tall duchess]348-a tolerably tall duchess , [he]110-valentin might have arrested [them]349-them on the spot . But all along [[his]110-valentin train]350-his train there was [nobody that could be a disguised Flambeau]351-nobody that could be a disguised flambeau , any more than a cat could be a disguised giraffe . About [the people on [the boat]313-the boat [he]110-valentin had already satisfied [himself]110-valentin]352-the people on the boat he had already satisfied himself ; and [the people]354-the people picked up at [Harwich]1-harwich or on the journey limited [themselves]354-the people with certainty to six . There was [a short railway official]355-a short railway official travelling up to [the terminus]356-the terminus , [three fairly short market gardeners]357-three fairly short market gardeners picked up [two stations]358-two stations afterwards , [one very short widow lady]359-one very short widow lady going up from [a small Essex town]360-a small essex town , and [a very short Roman Catholic priest]361-a very short roman catholic priest going up from [a small Essex village]362-a small essex village . When it came to the last case , [Valentin]110-valentin gave it up and almost laughed . [The little priest]363-the little priest was so much the essence of [those Eastern flats]364-those eastern flats ; [he]363-the little priest had a face as round and dull as a [Norfolk]9-norfolk dumpling ; [he]363-the little priest had eyes as empty as [the North Sea]365-the north sea ; [he]363-the little priest had several brown paper parcels , which [he]363-the little priest was quite incapable of collecting . [The Eucharistic Congress]366-the eucharistic congress had doubtless sucked out of [their]366-the eucharistic congress local stagnation many such creatures , blind and helpless , like [moles disinterred]367-moles disinterred . [Valentin]110-valentin was [a sceptic in the severe style of [France]10-france]368-a sceptic in the severe style of france , and could have no love for [priests]369-priests . But [he]110-valentin could have pity for [them]369-priests , and [this one]370-this one might have provoked pity in [anybody]371-anybody . [He]110-valentin had a large , shabby umbrella , which constantly fell on the floor . [He]110-valentin did not seem to know which was the right end of [his]110-valentin return ticket . [He]110-valentin explained with a moon - calf simplicity to everybody in [the carriage]372-the carriage that [he]110-valentin had to be careful , because [he]110-valentin had something made of real silver " with blue stones "[110-valentin] in one of [his]110-valentin brown - paper parcels . [His]110-valentin quaint blending of [Essex]11-essex flatness with saintly simplicity continuously amused [the Frenchman]373-the frenchman till [the priest]374-the priest arrived somehow at [Tottenham]12-tottenham with all [his]374-the priest parcels , and came back for [his]374-the priest umbrella . When [he]110-valentin did the last , [Valentin]110-valentin even had the good nature to warn [him]110-valentin not to take care of the silver by telling [everybody]375-everybody about it . But to whomever [he]110-valentin talked , [Valentin]110-valentin kept [his]110-valentin eye open for [someone else]376-someone else ; [he]110-valentin looked out steadily for [anyone , rich or poor , male or female , who was well up to six feet]377-anyone , rich or poor , male or female , who was well up to six feet ; for [Flambeau]111-flambeau was four inches above it .

[He]110-valentin alighted at [Liverpool Street]13-liverpool street , however , quite conscientiously secure that [he]110-valentin had not missed [the criminal]378-the criminal so far . [He]110-valentin then went to [Scotland Yard]14-scotland yard to regularise [his]110-valentin position and arrange for help in case of need ; [he]110-valentin then lit another cigarette and went for a long stroll in [the streets of [London]4-london]379-the streets of london . As [he]110-valentin was walking in [the streets]380-the streets and [squares beyond [Victoria]15-victoria]381-squares beyond victoria , [he]110-valentin paused suddenly and stood . [It]382-it was [a quaint , quiet square]383-a quaint , quiet square , very typical of [London]4-london , full of an accidental stillness . [The tall , flat houses round]384-the tall , flat houses round looked at once prosperous and uninhabited ; [the square of shrubbery in the centre]385-the square of shrubbery in the centre looked as deserted as [a green Pacific islet]386-a green pacific islet . One of the four sides was much higher than [the rest]387-the rest , like a dais ; and the line of this side was broken by one of [[London]4-london 's admirable accidents]388-london 's admirable accidents - [a restaurant that looked as if [it]389-a restaurant that looked as if it had strayed from soho had strayed from [Soho]16-soho]389-a restaurant that looked as if it had strayed from soho . It was an unreasonably attractive object , with dwarf plants in pots and long , striped blinds of lemon yellow and white . It stood specially high above [the street]390-the street , and in the usual patchwork way of [London]4-london , a flight of steps from [the street]390-the street ran up to meet the front door almost as a fire - escape might run up to a first - floor window . [Valentin]110-valentin stood and smoked in front of the yellow - white blinds and considered them long .

The most incredible thing about miracles is that they happen . A few clouds in heaven do come together into the staring shape of one human eye . A tree does stand up in the landscape of a doubtful journey in the exact and elaborate shape of a note of interrogation . [I]0-i have seen both these things [myself]0-i within the last few days . [Nelson]114-nelson does die in the instant of victory ; and [a man named [Williams]115-williams]392-a man named williams does quite accidentally murder [a man named [Williamson]116-williamson]393-a man named williamson ; it sounds like a sort of infanticide . In short , there is in life an element of elfin coincidence which [people reckoning on the prosaic]394-people reckoning on the prosaic may perpetually miss . As it has been well expressed in the paradox of [Poe]117-poe , wisdom should reckon on the unforeseen .

[Aristide Valentin]110-valentin was unfathomably French ; and the French intelligence is intelligence specially and solely . [He]110-valentin was not " [a thinking machine "]3285-a thinking machine "[110-valentin] ; for that is a brainless phrase of modern fatalism and materialism . A machine only is a machine because it can not think . But [he]110-valentin was [a thinking man]395-a thinking man , and [a plain man at the same time]396-a plain man at the same time . All [his]110-valentin wonderful successes , that looked like conjuring , had been gained by plodding logic , by clear and commonplace French thought . [The French]118-the french electrify [the world]322-the world not by starting any paradox , [they]118-the french electrify it by carrying out a truism . [They]118-the french carry a truism so far - as in the French Revolution . But exactly because [Valentin]110-valentin understood reason , [he]110-valentin understood the limits of reason . Only [a man who knows nothing of motors talks of motoring without petrol]398-a man who knows nothing of motors talks of motoring without petrol ; only [a man who knows nothing of reason talks of reasoning without strong , undisputed first principles]399-a man who knows nothing of reason talks of reasoning without strong , undisputed first principles . Here [he]110-valentin had no strong first principles . [Flambeau]111-flambeau had been missed at [Harwich]1-harwich ; and if [he]111-flambeau was in [London]4-london at all , [he]111-flambeau might be anything from a tall tramp on [Wimbledon Common]17-wimbledon common to [a tall toast - master at [the Hotel Metropole]401-the hotel metropole]400-a tall toast - master at the hotel metropole . In such a naked state of nescience , [Valentin]110-valentin had a view and a method of [his]110-valentin own .

In such cases [he]110-valentin reckoned on the unforeseen . In such cases , when [he]110-valentin could not follow [the train of the reasonable]402-the train of the reasonable , [he]110-valentin coldly and carefully followed [the train of [the unreasonable]404-the unreasonable]403-the train of the unreasonable . Instead of going to the right places - [banks]405-banks , [police stations]406-police stations , [rendezvous]407-rendezvous - [he]110-valentin systematically went to [the wrong places]408-the wrong places ; knocked at [every empty house]409-every empty house , turned down [every cul de sac]410-every cul de sac , went up [every lane]411-every lane blocked with rubbish , went round every crescent that led [him]110-valentin uselessly out of the way . [He]110-valentin defended this crazy course quite logically . [He]110-valentin said that if [one]412-one had a clue this was the worst way ; but if [one]412-one had no clue at all it was the best , because there was just the chance that any oddity that caught the eye of [the pursuer]414-the pursuer might be the same that had caught the eye of [the pursued]415-the pursued . Somewhere [a man]416-a man must begin , and it had better be just where [another man]417-another man might stop . Something about that flight of steps up to [the shop]418-the shop , something about the quietude and quaintness of [the restaurant]419-the restaurant , roused all [the detective]420-the detective 's rare romantic fancy and made [him]420-the detective resolve to strike at random . [He]110-valentin went up the steps , and sitting down at a table by the window , asked for a cup of black coffee .

It was half - way through the morning , and [he]110-valentin had not breakfasted ; the slight litter of other breakfasts stood about on the table to remind [him]110-valentin of [his]110-valentin hunger ; and adding a poached egg to [his]110-valentin order , [he]110-valentin proceeded musingly to shake some white sugar into [his]110-valentin coffee , thinking all the time about [Flambeau]111-flambeau . [He]110-valentin remembered how [Flambeau]111-flambeau had escaped , once by a pair of nail scissors , and once by [a house]421-a house on fire ; once by having to pay for an unstamped letter , and once by getting [people]338-people to look through a telescope at a comet that might destroy [the world]322-the world . [He]110-valentin thought [[his]110-valentin detective]424-his detective brain as good as [the criminal]378-the criminal 's , which was true . But [he]110-valentin fully realised the disadvantage . " [The criminal]378-the criminal is [the creative artist]3287-the creative artist ; [the detective]420-the detective only [the critic]3289-the critic , "[110-valentin] [he]110-valentin said with a sour smile , and lifted [his]110-valentin coffee cup to [his]110-valentin lips slowly , and put it down very quickly . [He]110-valentin had put salt in it .

[He]110-valentin looked at the vessel from which the silvery powder had come ; it was certainly a sugar - basin ; as unmistakably meant for sugar as a champagne - bottle for champagne . [He]110-valentin wondered why [they]426-they should keep salt in it . [He]110-valentin looked to see if there were [any more orthodox vessels]427-any more orthodox vessels . Yes ; there were [two salt - cellars]428-two salt - cellars quite full . Perhaps there was some speciality in the condiment in the salt - cellars . [He]110-valentin tasted it ; it was sugar . Then [he]110-valentin looked round at [the restaurant]419-the restaurant with a refreshed air of interest , to see if there were any other traces of that singular artistic taste which puts the sugar in [the salt - cellars]430-the salt - cellars and the salt in the sugar - basin . Except for an odd splash of some dark fluid on one of the white - papered walls , [the whole place]431-the whole place appeared neat , cheerful and ordinary . [He]110-valentin rang the bell for [the waiter]432-the waiter .

When [that official]433-that official hurried up , fuzzy - haired and somewhat blear - eyed at that early hour , [the detective who was not without an appreciation of the simpler forms of humour]434-the detective who was not without an appreciation of the simpler forms of humour asked [him]110-valentin to taste the sugar and see if it was up to the high reputation of [the hotel]435-the hotel . The result was that [the waiter]432-the waiter yawned suddenly and woke up .

" Do [you]432-the waiter play this delicate joke on [[your]432-the waiter customers]3290-your customers every morning ? "[110-valentin] inquired [Valentin]110-valentin . " Does changing the salt and sugar never pall on [you]432-the waiter as a jest ? "[110-valentin]

[The waiter]432-the waiter , when this irony grew clearer , stammeringly assured [him]110-valentin that [the establishment]438-the establishment had certainly no such intention ; it must be a most curious mistake . [He]110-valentin picked up the sugar - basin and looked at it ; [he]110-valentin picked up [the salt - cellar]439-the salt - cellar and looked at that , [his]110-valentin face growing more and more bewildered . [The street]390-the street [they]537-they threaded was so narrow and shut in by shadows that when [they]537-they came out unexpectedly into [the void common and vast sky]538-the void common and vast sky [they]537-they were startled to find the evening still so light and clear . A perfect dome of peacock - green sank into gold amid the blackening trees and the dark violet distances . The glowing green tint was just deep enough to pick out in points of crystal one or two stars . All that was left of the daylight lay in a golden glitter across [the edge of [Hampstead]19-hampstead]539-the edge of hampstead and [that popular hollow which is called [the Vale of Health]25-the vale of health]540-that popular hollow which is called the vale of health . [The holiday makers who roam [this region]542-this region]541-the holiday makers who roam this region had not wholly dispersed ; [a few couples]543-a few couples sat shapelessly on benches ; and here and there [a distant girl]544-a distant girl still shrieked in one of [the swings]545-the swings . The glory of heaven deepened and darkened around the sublime vulgarity of [man]546-man ; and standing on the slope and looking across [the valley]547-the valley , [Valentin]110-valentin beheld the thing which [he]110-valentin sought .

Among [the black and breaking groups in that distance]548-the black and breaking groups in that distance was one especially black which did not break - a group of two figures clerically clad . Though [they]537-they seemed as small as insects , [Valentin]110-valentin could see that one of [them]537-they was much smaller than the other . Though the other had [a student]549-a student 's stoop and an inconspicuous manner , [he]110-valentin could see that [the man]315-the man was well over six feet high . [He]110-valentin shut [his]110-valentin teeth and went forward , whirling [his]110-valentin stick impatiently . By the time [he]110-valentin had substantially diminished the distance and magnified [the two black figures]551-the two black figures as in a vast microscope , [he]110-valentin had perceived something else ; something which startled [him]110-valentin , and yet which [he]110-valentin had somehow expected . Whoever was [the tall priest]552-the tall priest , there could be no doubt about the identity of [the short one]553-the short one . [It]554-it was [[his]110-valentin friend of [the Harwich train]556-the harwich train , [the stumpy little cure of Essex whom [he]110-valentin had warned about [his]110-valentin brown paper parcels]557-the stumpy little cure of essex whom he had warned about his brown paper parcels]555-his friend of the harwich train , the stumpy little cure of essex whom he had warned about his brown paper parcels .

Now , so far as this went , everything fitted in finally and rationally enough . [Valentin]110-valentin had learned by [his]110-valentin inquiries that morning that [a Father Brown from [Essex]11-essex]558-a father brown from essex was bringing up a silver cross with sapphires , a relic of considerable value , to show [some of [the foreign priests at the congress]560-the foreign priests at the congress]559-some of the foreign priests at the congress . This undoubtedly was the ' silver with blue stones " ; and [Father Brown]121-father brown undoubtedly was the little greenhorn in [the train]3360-the train . Now there was nothing wonderful about the fact that what [Valentin]110-valentin had found out [Flambeau]111-flambeau had also found out ; [Flambeau]111-flambeau found out everything . Also there was nothing wonderful in the fact that when [Flambeau]111-flambeau heard of a sapphire cross [he]111-flambeau should try to steal it ; that was the most natural thing in all natural history . And most certainly there was nothing wonderful about the fact that [Flambeau]111-flambeau should have it all [his]111-flambeau own way with such a silly sheep as [the man with the umbrella and the parcels]3361-the man with the umbrella and the parcels . [He]111-flambeau was [the sort of man whom [anybody]371-anybody could lead on a string to [the North Pole]26-the north pole]3362-the sort of man whom anybody could lead on a string to the north pole ; it was not surprising that [an actor like [Flambeau]111-flambeau , dressed as [another priest]3365-another priest]3364-an actor like flambeau , dressed as another priest , could lead [him]111-flambeau to [Hampstead Heath]23-hampstead heath . So far the crime seemed clear enough ; and while [the detective]420-the detective pitied [the priest]374-the priest for [his]374-the priest helplessness , [he]420-the detective almost despised [Flambeau]111-flambeau for condescending to [so gullible a victim]3368-so gullible a victim . But when [Valentin]110-valentin thought of all that had happened in between , of all that had led [him]110-valentin to [his]110-valentin triumph , [he]110-valentin racked [his]110-valentin brains for the smallest rhyme or reason in it . What had it to do with calling nuts oranges , or with paying for windows first and breaking them afterwards ? [He]110-valentin had come to the end of [his]110-valentin chase ; yet somehow [he]110-valentin had missed the middle of it . The two figures that [they]561-they followed were crawling like black flies across the huge green contour of [a hill]562-a hill . [They]561-they were evidently sunk in conversation , and perhaps did not notice where [they]561-they were going ; but [they]561-they were certainly going to [the wilder and more silent heights of [the Heath]27-the heath]563-the wilder and more silent heights of the heath . As [[their]561-they pursuers]564-their pursuers gained on [them]561-they , [the latter]565-the latter had to use the undignified attitudes of [the deer - stalker]566-the deer - stalker , to crouch behind clumps of trees and even to crawl prostrate in deep grass . By these ungainly ingenuities [the hunters]567-the hunters even came close enough to [the quarry]568-the quarry to hear the murmur of the discussion , but no word could be distinguished except the word " reason "[567-the hunters] recurring frequently in a high and almost childish voice . Once over [an abrupt dip of land]569-an abrupt dip of land and a dense tangle of thickets , [the detectives]570-the detectives actually lost the two figures [they]570-the detectives were following . [They]570-the detectives did not find [the trail]571-the trail again for an agonising ten minutes , and then it led round the brow of [a great dome of hill overlooking [an amphitheatre of rich and desolate sunset scenery]573-an amphitheatre of rich and desolate sunset scenery]572-a great dome of hill overlooking an amphitheatre of rich and desolate sunset scenery . Under a tree in [this commanding yet neglected spot]574-this commanding yet neglected spot was an old ramshackle wooden seat . On this seat sat [the two priests]575-the two priests still in serious speech together . The gorgeous green and gold still clung to the darkening horizon ; but the dome above was turning slowly from peacock - green to peacock - blue , and the stars detached themselves more and more like solid jewels . Mutely motioning to [[his]576-he followers]577-his followers , [Valentin]110-valentin contrived to creep up behind the big branching tree , and , standing there in deathly silence , heard the words of [the strange priests]578-the strange priests for the first time .

After [he]576-he had listened for a minute and a half , [he]576-he was gripped by a devilish doubt . Perhaps [he]576-he had dragged [the two English policemen]579-the two english policemen to the wastes of [a nocturnal heath]580-a nocturnal heath on an errand no saner than seeking figs on its thistles . For [the two priests]575-the two priests were talking exactly like [priests]369-priests , piously , with learning and leisure , about the most aerial enigmas of theology . [The Secret Garden]615-the secret garden

[Aristide Valentin]110-valentin , [Chief of [the Paris Police]320-the paris police]616-chief of the paris police , was late for [his]110-valentin dinner , and [some of [[his]110-valentin guests]619-his guests]618-some of his guests began to arrive before [him]110-valentin . [These]620-these were , however , reassured by [[his]110-valentin confidential servant]621-his confidential servant , [Ivan]122-ivan , [the old man with a scar , and a face almost as grey as [his]122-ivan moustaches , who always sat at a table in [the entrance hall]623-the entrance hall]622-the old man with a scar , and a face almost as grey as his moustaches , who always sat at a table in the entrance hall - [a hall hung with weapons]624-a hall hung with weapons . [[Valentin]110-valentin 's house]625-valentin 's house was perhaps as peculiar and celebrated as [[its]625-valentin 's house master]626-its master . [It]625-valentin 's house was [an old house]627-an old house , with high walls and tall poplars almost overhanging [the Seine]30-the seine ; but the oddity - and perhaps the police value - of [its]625-valentin 's house architecture was this : that there was no ultimate exit at all except through this front door , which was guarded by [Ivan]122-ivan and [the armoury]628-the armoury . [The garden]629-the garden was large and elaborate , and there were many exits from [the house]630-the house into [the garden]629-the garden . But there was no exit from [the garden]629-the garden into [the world]322-the world outside ; all round [it]629-the garden ran a tall , smooth , unscalable wall with special spikes at the top ; [no bad garden]634-no bad garden , perhaps , for [a man to reflect in whom [some hundred criminals]636-some hundred criminals had sworn to kill]635-a man to reflect in whom some hundred criminals had sworn to kill .

As [Ivan]122-ivan explained to [the guests]637-the guests , [[their]637-the guests host]638-their host had telephoned that [he]122-ivan was detained for ten minutes . [He]122-ivan was , in truth , making some last arrangements about executions and such ugly things ; and though these duties were rootedly repulsive to [him]122-ivan , [he]122-ivan always performed them with precision . Ruthless in the pursuit of [criminals]639-criminals , [he]122-ivan was very mild about [their]639-criminals punishment . Since [he]122-ivan had been supreme over French - and largely over European - policial methods , [his]122-ivan great influence had been honourably used for the mitigation of sentences and the purification of [prisons]640-prisons . [He]122-ivan was one of [the great humanitarian French freethinkers]641-the great humanitarian french freethinkers ; and the only thing wrong with [them]641-the great humanitarian french freethinkers is that [they]641-the great humanitarian french freethinkers make mercy even colder than justice .

When [Valentin]110-valentin arrived [he]110-valentin was already dressed in black clothes and the red rosette - an elegant figure , [his]110-valentin dark beard already streaked with grey . [He]110-valentin went straight through [[his]110-valentin house]642-his house to [[his]110-valentin study]643-his study , which opened on [the grounds]644-the grounds behind . [The garden door of [it]643-his study]645-the garden door of it was open , and after [he]110-valentin had carefully locked [his]110-valentin box in [its]643-his study official place , [he]110-valentin stood for a few seconds at the open door looking out upon [the garden]629-the garden . A sharp moon was fighting with the flying rags and tatters of a storm , and [Valentin]110-valentin regarded it with a wistfulness unusual in such scientific natures as [his]110-valentin . Perhaps such scientific natures have some psychic prevision of the most tremendous problem of [their]647-their lives . From any such occult mood , at least , [he]110-valentin quickly recovered , for [he]110-valentin knew [he]110-valentin was late , and that [[his]110-valentin guests]619-his guests had already begun to arrive . A glance at [[his]110-valentin drawing - room]649-his drawing - room when [he]110-valentin entered it was enough to make certain that [[his]110-valentin principal guest]650-his principal guest was not there , at any rate . [He]110-valentin saw - perhaps with more interest than any of these - [a tall man in uniform , who had bowed to [the Galloways]127-the galloways without receiving any very hearty acknowledgment , and who now advanced alone to pay [his]110-valentin respects to [[his]110-valentin host]661-his host]660-a tall man in uniform , who had bowed to the galloways without receiving any very hearty acknowledgment , and who now advanced alone to pay his respects to his host . [He]128-o'brien was by birth [an Irish gentleman]664-an irish gentleman , and in boyhood had known [the Galloways]127-the galloways - especially [Margaret Graham]125-lady margaret . [He]128-o'brien had left [[his]128-o'brien country]665-his country after some crash of debts , and now expressed [his]128-o'brien complete freedom from British etiquette by swinging about in uniform , sabre and spurs . The solid appearance of [Julius K. Brayne]129-brayne in [the room]683-the room was as decisive as a dinner bell . [He]130-brayne had this great quality , which [very few of [us]685-us]684-very few of us can claim , that [his]130-brayne presence was as big as [his]130-brayne absence . [He]130-brayne was [a huge fellow]686-a huge fellow , as fat as [he]130-brayne was tall , clad in complete evening black , without so much relief as a watch - chain or a ring . Except on one point [the Galloways]127-the galloways were genial and casual enough . " But the instant [he]123-lord galloway opened the salon door [he]123-lord galloway saw only one thing - [he]123-lord galloway saw what was not there . As [he]123-lord galloway did so [he]123-lord galloway tripped over some tree or stone in the grass ; looked down at it first with irritation and then a second time with curiosity . " [We]3435-we must tell [Valentin]110-valentin at once , "[696-the doctor] said [the doctor]696-the doctor , when [the other]482-the other had brokenly described all that [he]696-the doctor had dared to examine . [They]749-they lifted [him]123-lord galloway carefully an inch from the ground , and all doubts as to [his]123-lord galloway being really dead were settled at once and frightfully . [It]756-it was slightly slashed about the neck and jaw , but the face was substantially unhurt . " [Everyone here]3475-everyone here knows that [a dead man]3476-a dead man has been found in [the garden]629-the garden , [his]3476-a dead man head cut clean from [his]3476-a dead man body . " Speaking within modern probabilities , [I]696-the doctor really have n't , "[696-the doctor] said [the doctor]696-the doctor , arching [his]696-the doctor painful brows . [Commandant O'Brien]128-o'brien followed [the others]852-the others towards [the inquest]853-the inquest , feeling decidedly sick . The Queer Feet

If [you]916-you meet [a member of [that select club]918-that select club]917-a member of that select club , " [The Twelve True Fishermen]3610-the twelve true fishermen , "[917-a member of that select club] entering [the Vernon Hotel]919-the vernon hotel for the annual club dinner , [you]916-you will observe , as [he]917-a member of that select club takes off [his]917-a member of that select club overcoat , that [his]917-a member of that select club evening coat is green and not black . If supposing that [you]916-you have the star - defying audacity to address such a being [you]916-you ask [him]917-a member of that select club why , [he]917-a member of that select club will probably answer that [he]917-a member of that select club does it to avoid being mistaken for [a waiter]920-a waiter . [You]916-you will then retire crushed . But [you]916-you will leave behind [you]916-you a mystery as yet unsolved and a tale worth telling .

If to pursue the same vein of improbable conjecture [you]916-you were to meet [a mild , hard - working little priest]921-a mild , hard - working little priest , named [Father Brown]121-father brown , and were to ask [him]921-a mild , hard - working little priest what [he]921-a mild , hard - working little priest thought was the most singular luck of [his]921-a mild , hard - working little priest life , [he]921-a mild , hard - working little priest would probably reply that upon the whole [his]921-a mild , hard - working little priest best stroke was at [the Vernon Hotel]919-the vernon hotel , where [he]921-a mild , hard - working little priest had averted a crime and , perhaps , saved a soul , merely by listening to a few footsteps in [a passage]923-a passage . [He]921-a mild , hard - working little priest is perhaps a little proud of this wild and wonderful guess of [his]921-a mild , hard - working little priest , and it is possible that [he]921-a mild , hard - working little priest might refer to it . But since it is immeasurably unlikely that [you]916-you will ever rise high enough in [the social world]924-the social world to find " [The Twelve True Fishermen]3610-the twelve true fishermen , "[0-i] or that [you]916-you will ever sink low enough among slums and [criminals]639-criminals to find [Father Brown]121-father brown , [I]0-i fear [you]916-you will never hear the story at all unless [you]916-you hear it from [me]0-i .

[The Vernon Hotel at which [The Twelve True Fishermen]3610-the twelve true fishermen held [their]3610-the twelve true fishermen annual dinners]926-the vernon hotel at which the twelve true fishermen held their annual dinners was an institution such as can only exist in [an oligarchical society which has almost gone mad on good manners]928-an oligarchical society which has almost gone mad on good manners . It was that topsy - turvy product - an " exclusive "[931-a plutocracy tradesmen] commercial enterprise . That is , it was a thing which paid not by attracting [people]338-people , but actually by turning [people]338-people away . In the heart of [a plutocracy tradesmen]931-a plutocracy tradesmen become cunning enough to be more fastidious than [[their]931-a plutocracy tradesmen customers]932-their customers . [They]931-a plutocracy tradesmen positively create difficulties so that [[their]931-a plutocracy tradesmen wealthy and weary clients]933-their wealthy and weary clients may spend money and diplomacy in overcoming [them]931-a plutocracy tradesmen . If there were [a fashionable hotel in [London]4-london which [no man]935-no man could enter who was under six foot]934-a fashionable hotel in london which no man could enter who was under six foot , [society]936-society would meekly make up [parties of six - foot men]937-parties of six - foot men to dine in [it]934-a fashionable hotel in london which no man could enter who was under six foot . If there were [an expensive restaurant which by a mere caprice of [[its]938-an expensive restaurant which by a mere caprice of its proprietor proprietor]939-its proprietor]938-an expensive restaurant which by a mere caprice of its proprietor was only open on Thursday afternoon , [it]938-an expensive restaurant which by a mere caprice of its proprietor would be crowded on Thursday afternoon . [The Vernon Hotel]41-the vernon hotel stood , as if by accident , in [the corner of [a square in [Belgravia]42-belgravia]941-a square in belgravia]940-the corner of a square in belgravia . It was [a small hotel]942-a small hotel ; and [a very inconvenient one]943-a very inconvenient one . But [its]41-the vernon hotel very inconveniences were considered as walls protecting [a particular class]944-a particular class . One inconvenience , in particular , was held to be of vital importance : the fact that [practically only twenty - four people]945-practically only twenty - four people could dine in [the place]3350-the place at once . The only big dinner table was the celebrated terrace table , which stood open to the air on a sort of veranda overlooking one of [the most exquisite old gardens in [London]4-london]947-the most exquisite old gardens in london . Thus it happened that even the twenty - four seats at this table could only be enjoyed in warm weather ; and this making the enjoyment yet more difficult made it yet more desired . [The existing owner of [the hotel]435-the hotel]948-the existing owner of the hotel was [a Jew named [Lever]144-mr. lever]950-a jew named lever ; and [he]144-mr. lever made nearly a million out of it , by making it difficult to get into . Of course [he]144-mr. lever combined with this limitation in the scope of [his]144-mr. lever enterprise the most careful polish in its performance . The wines and cooking were really as good as any in [Europe]2-europe , and the demeanour of [the attendants]951-the attendants exactly mirrored the fixed mood of [the English upper class]952-the english upper class . [The proprietor]440-the proprietor knew all [[his]440-the proprietor waiters]954-his waiters like the fingers on [his]440-the proprietor hand ; there were only fifteen of [them]954-his waiters all told . It was much easier to become [a Member of Parliament]955-a member of parliament than to become [a waiter]920-a waiter in [that hotel]957-that hotel . [Each waiter]958-each waiter was trained in terrible silence and smoothness , as if [he]958-each waiter were [[a gentleman]746-a gentleman 's servant]960-a gentleman 's servant . And , indeed , there was generally at least [one waiter to every gentleman who dined .

[The club of [The Twelve True Fishermen]3610-the twelve true fishermen]962-the club of the twelve true fishermen]961-one waiter to every gentleman who dined . the club of the twelve true fishermen would not have consented to dine anywhere but in such a place , for [it]962-the club of the twelve true fishermen insisted on a luxurious privacy ; and would have been quite upset by the mere thought that any other club was even dining in [the same building]964-the same building . On the occasion of [their]3610-the twelve true fishermen annual dinner [the Fishermen]965-the fishermen were in the habit of exposing all [their]3610-the twelve true fishermen treasures , as if [they]3610-the twelve true fishermen were in [a private house]966-a private house , especially the celebrated set of fish knives and forks which were , as it were , the insignia of [the society]967-the society , each being exquisitely wrought in silver in the form of a fish , and each loaded at the hilt with one large pearl . These were always laid out for the fish course , and the fish course was always the most magnificent in that magnificent repast . [The society]967-the society had a vast number of ceremonies and observances , but it had no history and no object ; that was where it was so very aristocratic . [You]969-you did not have to be anything in order to be [one of [the Twelve Fishers]971-the twelve fishers]970-one of the twelve fishers ; unless [you]969-you were already [a certain sort of person]972-a certain sort of person , [you]969-you never even heard of [them]971-the twelve fishers . [It]967-the society had been in existence twelve years . [Its president]973-its president was [Mr. Audley]145-mr. audley . [[Its]967-the society vice - president]974-its vice - president was [the Duke of [Chester]43-chester]975-the duke of chester .

If [I]0-i have in any degree conveyed the atmosphere of [this appalling hotel]976-this appalling hotel , [the reader]977-the reader may feel a natural wonder as to how [I]0-i came to know anything about it , and may even speculate as to how so ordinary a person as [[my]0-i friend]3397-my friend [Father Brown]121-father brown came to find [himself]121-father brown in [that golden galley]979-that golden galley . As far as that is concerned , [my]0-i story is simple , or even vulgar . There is in [the world]322-the world [a very aged rioter]981-a very aged rioter and demagogue who breaks into the most refined retreats with the dreadful information that [all men]982-all men are [brothers]983-brothers , and wherever [this leveller]984-this leveller went on [his]984-this leveller pale horse it was [Father Brown]121-father brown 's trade to follow . [One of [the waiters]986-the waiters]985-one of the waiters , [an Italian]987-an italian , had been struck down with a paralytic stroke that afternoon ; and [[his]985-one of the waiters Jewish employer]988-his jewish employer , marvelling mildly at such superstitions , had consented to send for [the nearest Popish priest]989-the nearest popish priest . With what [the waiter]432-the waiter confessed to [Father Brown]121-father brown [we]991-we are not concerned , for the excellent reason that [that cleric]992-that cleric kept it to [himself]992-that cleric ; but apparently it involved [him]992-that cleric in writing out a note or statement for the conveying of some message or the righting of some wrong . [Father Brown]121-father brown , therefore , with a meek impudence which [he]121-father brown would have shown equally in [Buckingham Palace]44-buckingham palace , asked to be provided with [a room]993-a room and writing materials . [Mr. Lever]144-mr. lever was torn in two . [He]992-that cleric was [a kind man]994-a kind man , and had also that bad imitation of kindness , the dislike of any difficulty or scene . At the same time the presence of [one unusual stranger]995-one unusual stranger in [[his]992-that cleric hotel]996-his hotel that evening was like a speck of dirt on something just cleaned . There was never [any borderland or anteroom in [the Vernon Hotel]919-the vernon hotel]997-any borderland or anteroom in the vernon hotel , [no people]999-no people waiting in [the hall]1000-the hall , [no customers]1001-no customers coming in on chance . There were [fifteen waiters]1002-fifteen waiters . There were [twelve guests]1003-twelve guests . It would be as startling to find [a new guest]1004-a new guest in [the hotel]435-the hotel that night as to find [a new brother]1006-a new brother taking breakfast or tea in [[one]412-one 's own family]1008-one 's own family . Moreover , [the priest]374-the priest 's appearance was second - rate and [his]374-the priest clothes muddy ; a mere glimpse of [him]374-the priest afar off might precipitate a crisis in [the club]1010-the club . [Mr. Lever]144-mr. lever at last hit on a plan to cover , since [he]144-mr. lever might not obliterate , the disgrace . In [this office]1023-this office sat [the representative of [the proprietor nobody in [this place]1026-this place]1025-the proprietor nobody in this place ever appeared in person if [he]1025-the proprietor nobody in this place could help [it]1027-it , and just beyond [the office]1028-the office , on the way to [[the servants]1029-the servants ' quarters]1030-the servants ' quarters]1024-the representative of the proprietor nobody in this place ever appeared in person if he could help it , and just beyond the office , on the way to the servants ' quarters , was [[the gentlemen]1031-the gentlemen 's cloak room]1032-the gentlemen 's cloak room , the last boundary of [[the gentlemen]1031-the gentlemen 's domain]1034-the gentlemen 's domain . The story which [Father Brown]121-father brown was writing down was very likely a much better story than this one , only it will never be known . [I]0-i can merely state that it was very nearly as long , and that the last two or three paragraphs of it were the least exciting and absorbing .

For it was by the time that [he]121-father brown had reached these that [the priest]374-the priest began a little to allow [his]121-father brown thoughts to wander and [his]121-father brown animal senses , which were commonly keen , to awaken . The time of darkness and dinner was drawing on ; [[his]121-father brown own forgotten little room]1043-his own forgotten little room was without a light , and perhaps the gathering gloom , as occasionally happens , sharpened the sense of sound . As [Father Brown]121-father brown wrote the last and least essential part of [his]121-father brown document , [he]121-father brown caught [himself]121-father brown writing to the rhythm of a recurrent noise outside , just as [one]412-one sometimes thinks to the tune of [a railway train]1045-a railway train . When [he]121-father brown became conscious of the thing [he]121-father brown found what it was : only the ordinary patter of feet passing the door , which in [an hotel]1046-an hotel was no very unlikely matter . Nevertheless , [he]121-father brown stared at the darkened ceiling , and listened to the sound . After [he]121-father brown had listened for a few seconds dreamily , [he]121-father brown got to [his]121-father brown feet and listened intently , with [his]121-father brown head a little on one side . Then [he]121-father brown sat down again and buried [his]121-father brown brow in [his]121-father brown hands , now not merely listening , but listening and thinking also .

The footsteps outside at any given moment were such as [one]412-one might hear in [any hotel]1048-any hotel ; and yet , taken as a whole , there was something very strange about [them]1049-them . There were no other footsteps . It was always [a very silent house]1050-a very silent house , for [the few familiar guests]1051-the few familiar guests went at once to [[their]1051-the few familiar guests own apartments]1052-their own apartments , and [the well - trained waiters]1053-the well - trained waiters were told to be almost invisible until [they]1053-the well - trained waiters were wanted . [One]412-one could not conceive any place where there was less reason to apprehend anything irregular . But these footsteps were so odd that [one]412-one could not decide to call them regular or irregular . [Father Brown]121-father brown followed [them]1049-them with [his]121-father brown finger on the edge of the table , like [a man trying to learn a tune on the piano]1056-a man trying to learn a tune on the piano .

First , there came a long rush of rapid little steps , such as [a light man]1057-a light man might make in winning a walking race . At a certain point [they]1049-them stopped and changed to a sort of slow , swinging stamp , numbering not a quarter of the steps , but occupying about the same time . The moment the last echoing stamp had died away would come again the run or ripple of light , hurrying feet , and then again the thud of the heavier walking . It was certainly the same pair of boots , partly because as has been said there were no other boots about , and partly because they had a small but unmistakable creak in them . [Father Brown]121-father brown had the kind of head that can not help asking questions ; and on this apparently trivial question [his]121-father brown head almost split . [He]121-father brown had seen [men]3431-men run in order to jump . [He]121-father brown had seen [men]3431-men run in order to slide . But why on earth should [a man]416-a man run in order to walk ? Or , again , why should [he]416-a man walk in order to run ? Yet no other description would cover the antics of this invisible pair of legs . [The man]315-the man was either walking very fast down one - half of [the corridor]1062-the corridor in order to walk very slow down the other half ; or [he]315-the man was walking very slow at one end to have the rapture of walking fast at the other . Neither suggestion seemed to make much sense . [His]121-father brown brain was growing darker and darker , like [[his]121-father brown room]1063-his room .

Yet , as [he]121-father brown began to think steadily , the very blackness of [[his]121-father brown cell]1064-his cell seemed to make [his]121-father brown thoughts more vivid ; [he]121-father brown began to see as in a kind of vision the fantastic feet capering along [the corridor]1062-the corridor in unnatural or symbolic attitudes . Was it a heathen religious dance ? Or some entirely new kind of scientific exercise ? [Father Brown]121-father brown began to ask [himself]121-father brown with more exactness what the steps suggested . Taking the slow step first : it certainly was not the step of [the proprietor]440-the proprietor . [Men of [his]121-father brown type]1067-men of his type walk with a rapid waddle , or [they]1067-men of his type sit still . It could not be [any servant]1068-any servant or [messenger]1069-messenger waiting for directions . It did not sound like it . [The poorer orders in [an oligarchy]1071-an oligarchy]1070-the poorer orders in an oligarchy sometimes lurch about when [they]1070-the poorer orders in an oligarchy are slightly drunk , but generally , and especially in such gorgeous scenes , [they]1070-the poorer orders in an oligarchy stand or sit in constrained attitudes . No ; that heavy yet springy step , with a kind of careless emphasis , not specially noisy , yet not caring what noise it made , belonged to only [one of the animals of [this earth]1073-this earth]1072-one of the animals of this earth . [It]1072-one of the animals of this earth was [a gentleman of [western Europe]2-europe]1074-a gentleman of western europe , and probably [one who had never worked for [his]1075-one who had never worked for his living living]1075-one who had never worked for his living .

Just as [he]121-father brown came to this solid certainty , the step changed to [the quicker one]1076-the quicker one , and ran past the door as feverishly as a rat . [The listener]1077-the listener remarked that though this step was much swifter it was also much more noiseless , almost as if [the man]315-the man were walking on tiptoe . Yet it was not associated in [his]121-father brown mind with secrecy , but with something else - something that [he]121-father brown could not remember . [He]121-father brown was maddened by one of those half - memories that make [a man]416-a man feel half - witted . Surely [he]121-father brown had heard that strange , swift walking somewhere . Suddenly [he]121-father brown sprang to [his]121-father brown feet with a new idea in [his]121-father brown head , and walked to the door . [[His]121-father brown room]1063-his room had no direct outlet on [the passage]715-the passage , but let on one side into [the glass office]1082-the glass office , and on the other into [the cloak room beyond]1083-the cloak room beyond . [He]121-father brown tried the door into [the office]1028-the office , and found [it]1085-it locked . Then [he]121-father brown looked at the window , now a square pane full of purple cloud cleft by livid sunset , and for an instant [he]121-father brown smelt evil as a dog smells rats .

The rational part of [him]121-father brown whether the wiser or not regained its supremacy . [He]121-father brown remembered that [the proprietor]440-the proprietor had told [him]121-father brown that [he]121-father brown should lock the door , and would come later to release [him]121-father brown . Bringing [his]121-father brown paper to the window so as to catch the last stormy evening light , [he]121-father brown resolutely plunged once more into the almost completed record . [He]121-father brown had written for about twenty minutes , bending closer and closer to [his]121-father brown paper in the lessening light ; then suddenly [he]121-father brown sat upright . [He]121-father brown had heard the strange feet once more .

This time they had a third oddity . Previously [the unknown man]1087-the unknown man had walked , with levity indeed and lightning quickness , but [he]1087-the unknown man had walked . This time [he]1087-the unknown man ran . [One]412-one could hear the swift , soft , bounding steps coming along [the corridor]1062-the corridor , like the pads of a fleeing and leaping panther . [Whoever was coming]1090-whoever was coming was [a very strong , active man , in still yet tearing excitement]1091-a very strong , active man , in still yet tearing excitement . Yet , when the sound had swept up to [the office]1028-the office like a sort of whispering whirlwind , it suddenly changed again to the old slow , swaggering stamp .

[Father Brown]121-father brown flung down [his]121-father brown paper , and , knowing the office door to be locked , went at once into [the cloak room]1036-the cloak room on the other side . [The attendant of [this place]1026-this place]1094-the attendant of this place was temporarily absent , probably because [the only guests]1096-the only guests were at dinner and [[his]121-father brown office]1097-his office was a sinecure . [A waiter]920-a waiter came swiftly along [the room]683-the room , and then stopped dead . [The waiter]432-the waiter stood staring a few seconds , while there deepened on every face at table a strange shame which is wholly the product of [our]1185-us time . It is the combination of modern humanitarianism with the horrible modern abyss between the souls of [the rich and poor]1187-the rich and poor . [A genuine historic aristocrat]1188-a genuine historic aristocrat would have thrown things at [the waiter]432-the waiter , beginning with empty bottles , and very probably ending with money . [A genuine democrat]1190-a genuine democrat would have asked [him]432-the waiter , with comrade - like clearness of speech , what the devil [he]432-the waiter was doing . But [these modern plutocrats]1191-these modern plutocrats could not bear [a poor man]1192-a poor man near to [them]1191-these modern plutocrats , either as [a slave]1193-a slave or as [a friend]1194-a friend . That something had gone wrong with [the servants]1029-the servants was merely a dull , hot embarrassment . [They]1181-all those vague and kindly gentlemen did not want to be brutal , and [they]1181-all those vague and kindly gentlemen dreaded the need to be benevolent . [They]1181-all those vague and kindly gentlemen wanted the thing , whatever it was , to be over . It was over . " [You]1219-the colonel see , [colonel]3662-colonel , "[121-father brown] [he]121-father brown said , " [I]121-father brown was shut up in [that small room there]3663-that small room there doing some writing , when [I]121-father brown heard a pair of feet in [this passage]3664-this passage doing a dance that was as queer as the dance of death . But they were both made by the same feet , [I]121-father brown swear , and they came in rotation ; first the run and then the walk , and then the run again . [I]121-father brown wondered at first idly and then wildly why [a man]416-a man should act these two parts at once . One walk [I]121-father brown knew ; it was just like [yours]3668-yours , [colonel]3662-colonel . It was the walk of [a well - fed gentleman]3670-a well - fed gentleman waiting for something , who strolls about rather because [he]121-father brown is physically alert than because [he]121-father brown is mentally impatient . Then [I]121-father brown thought for a minute and a half more . [Colonel Pound]147-colonel pound looked at [him]147-colonel pound keenly , but [the speaker]1175-the speaker 's mild grey eyes were fixed upon the ceiling with almost empty wistfulness .

" A crime , "[147-colonel pound] [he]147-colonel pound said slowly , " is like any other work of art . Do n't look surprised ; crimes are by no means the only works of art that come from [an infernal workshop]3672-an infernal workshop . But every work of art , divine or diabolic , has one indispensable mark - [I]147-colonel pound mean , that the centre of it is simple , however much the fulfilment may be complicated . Thus , in Hamlet , let [us]3673-us say , the grotesqueness of [the grave - digger]3674-the grave - digger , the flowers of [the mad girl]3675-the mad girl , the fantastic finery of [Osric]152-osric , the pallor of the ghost and the grin of the skull are all oddities in a sort of tangled wreath round one plain tragic figure of [a man in black]3676-a man in black . Well , this also , "[147-colonel pound] [he]147-colonel pound said , getting slowly down from [his]147-colonel pound seat with a smile , " this also is the plain tragedy of [a man in black]3676-a man in black . Yes , "[147-colonel pound] [he]147-colonel pound went on , seeing [the colonel]1219-the colonel look up in some wonder , " the whole of this tale turns on a black coat . In this , as in [Hamlet]48-hamlet , there are the rococo excrescences - [yourselves]3678-yourselves , let [us]3673-us say . There is [the dead waiter]3679-the dead waiter , who was there when [he]3679-the dead waiter could not be there . There is the invisible hand that swept [your]3678-yourselves table clear of silver and melted into air . But every clever crime is founded ultimately on some one quite simple fact - some fact that is not itself mysterious . The mystification comes in covering it up , in leading [men]3431-men 's thoughts away from it . This large and subtle and in the ordinary course most profitable crime , was built on the plain fact that [a gentleman]746-a gentleman 's evening dress is the same as [a waiter]920-a waiter 's . All the rest was acting , and thundering good acting , too . "[147-colonel pound]

" [His]3684-this archangel of impudence who stole your forks worst moment was when [the waiters]986-the waiters stood in a row ; but even then [he]3684-this archangel of impudence who stole your forks contrived to lean against the wall just round the corner in such a way that for that important instant [the waiters]986-the waiters thought [him]3684-this archangel of impudence who stole your forks [a gentleman]746-a gentleman , while [the gentlemen]1031-the gentlemen thought [him]3684-this archangel of impudence who stole your forks [a waiter]920-a waiter . " The most beautiful crime [I]146-flambeau ever committed , "[146-flambeau] [Flambeau]146-flambeau would say in [his]146-flambeau highly moral old age , " was also , by a singular coincidence , [my]146-flambeau last . It was committed at Christmas . As [an artist]612-an artist [I]146-flambeau had always attempted to provide crimes suitable to the special season or landscapes in which [I]146-flambeau found [myself]146-flambeau , choosing this or [that terrace]3743-that terrace or garden for a catastrophe , as if for [a statuary group]3744-a statuary group . Thus [squires]3745-squires should be swindled in [long rooms panelled with oak]3746-long rooms panelled with oak ; while [Jews]3747-jews , on the other hand , should rather find [themselves]3747-jews unexpectedly penniless among the lights and screens of [the Cafe Riche]3748-the cafe riche . Thus , in [England]5-england , if [I]146-flambeau wished to relieve [a dean]3749-a dean of [his]3749-a dean riches which is not so easy as [you]3750-you might suppose , [I]146-flambeau wished to frame [him]3749-a dean , if [I]146-flambeau make [myself]146-flambeau clear , in [the green lawns and grey towers of [some cathedral town]3752-some cathedral town]3751-the green lawns and grey towers of some cathedral town . " Well , [my]146-flambeau last crime was a Christmas crime , a cheery , cosy , English middle - class crime ; a crime of [Charles Dickens]154-charles dickens . [Flambeau]146-flambeau would then proceed to tell the story from the inside ; and even from the inside it was odd . But for the attractive face [she]1302-a young girl might have been a small toddling bear .

The winter afternoon was reddening towards evening , and already a ruby light was rolled over the bloomless beds , filling them , as it were , with the ghosts of the dead roses . On one side of [the house]630-the house stood [the stable]1300-the stable , on the other an alley or cloister of laurels led to [the larger garden]1305-the larger garden behind . How even such a banquet of bosh was got ready in the time remained a riddle . But [they]1389-they went at it with that mixture of recklessness and industry that lives when [youth]1390-youth is in [a house]421-a house ; and [youth]1390-youth was in [that house]1393-that house that night , though not all may have isolated the two faces and hearts from which it flamed . As always happens , the invention grew wilder and wilder through the very tameness of the bourgeois conventions from which it had to create . [The columbine]1394-the columbine looked charming in an outstanding skirt that strangely resembled the large lamp - shade in [the drawing - room]709-the drawing - room . [Father Brown]121-father brown , though [he]121-father brown knew every detail done behind the scenes , and had even evoked applause by [his]121-father brown transformation of a pillow into [a pantomime baby]1403-a pantomime baby , went round to the front and sat among [the audience]829-the audience with all the solemn expectation of [a child]890-a child at [his]890-a child first matinee . [The spectators]1406-the spectators were [few , relations]1407-few , relations , [one or two local friends]1408-one or two local friends , and [the servants]1029-the servants ; [Sir Leopold]157-fischer sat in the front seat , [his]157-fischer full and still fur - collared figure largely obscuring the view of [the little cleric behind [him]157-fischer]1410-the little cleric behind him ; but it has never been settled by [artistic authorities]1411-artistic authorities whether [the cleric]901-the cleric lost much . The pantomime was utterly chaotic , yet not contemptible ; there ran through it a rage of improvisation which came chiefly from [Crook]155-crook [the clown]1413-the clown . Commonly [he]155-crook was [a clever man]1414-a clever man , and [he]155-crook was inspired tonight with a wild omniscience , a folly wiser than [the world]322-the world , that which comes to [a young man who has seen for an instant a particular expression on a particular face]1416-a young man who has seen for an instant a particular expression on a particular face . [He]155-crook was supposed to be [the clown]1413-the clown , but [he]155-crook was really almost everything else , [the author]1418-the author so far as there was [an author]1419-an author , [the prompter]1420-the prompter , [the scene - painter]1421-the scene - painter , [the scene - shifter]1422-the scene - shifter , and , above all , [the orchestra]1423-the orchestra . At abrupt intervals in the outrageous performance [he]155-crook would hurl [himself]155-crook in full costume at the piano and bang out some popular music equally absurd and appropriate .

The climax of this , as of all else , was the moment when the two front doors at the back of the scene flew open , showing [the lovely moonlit garden]1424-the lovely moonlit garden , but showing more prominently [the famous professional guest]1425-the famous professional guest ; [the great Florian]1426-the great florian , dressed up as [a policeman]334-a policeman . [The harlequin]1399-the harlequin leapt upon [him]155-crook and hit [him]155-crook over the helmet ; [the pianist]1433-the pianist playing " Where did [you]155-crook get that hat ? Then [the harlequin]1399-the harlequin rushed right into the arms of [the policeman]469-the policeman and fell on top of [him]469-the policeman , amid a roar of applause . It was almost impossible to believe that [a living person]1440-a living person could appear so limp .

[The athletic harlequin]1441-the athletic harlequin swung [him]155-crook about like a sack or twisted or tossed [him]155-crook like an Indian club ; all the time to the most maddeningly ludicrous tunes from the piano . [The priest]374-the priest had only watched for a few more minutes the absurd but not inelegant dance of [the amateur harlequin over [[his]1448-the city magnate in front of him splendidly unconscious foe]1453-his splendidly unconscious foe]1452-the amateur harlequin over his splendidly unconscious foe . There were hollows and bowers at the extreme end of [that leafy garden]1477-that leafy garden , in which the laurels and other immortal shrubs showed against sapphire sky and silver moon , even in that midwinter , warm colours as of [the south]1478-the south . The green gaiety of the waving laurels , the rich purple indigo of the night , the moon like a monstrous crystal , make an almost irresponsible romantic picture ; and among the top branches of the garden trees a strange figure is climbing , who looks not so much romantic as impossible . [He]121-father brown sparkles from head to heel , as if clad in ten million moons ; the real moon catches [him]121-father brown at every movement and sets a new inch of [him]121-father brown on fire . But [he]121-father brown swings , flashing and successful , from the short tree in [this garden]3444-this garden to the tall , rambling tree in the other , and only stops there because a shade has slid under the smaller tree and has unmistakably called up to [him]121-father brown .

" Well , [Flambeau]146-flambeau , "[1480-the silver , sparkling figure above] says the voice , " [you]146-flambeau really look like a Flying Star ; but that always means a Falling Star at last . "[1480-the silver , sparkling figure above]

[The silver , sparkling figure above]1480-the silver , sparkling figure above seems to lean forward in the laurels and , confident of escape , listens to [the little figure below]1481-the little figure below . " [You]146-flambeau never did anything better , [Flambeau]146-flambeau . It was clever to come from [Canada]53-canada with a [Paris]35-paris ticket , [I]1481-the little figure below suppose just a week after [Mrs. Adams]171-mrs. adams died , when [no one]3557-no one was in a mood to ask questions . It was cleverer to have marked down the Flying Stars and the very day of [Fischer]157-fischer 's coming . But there 's no cleverness , but mere genius , in what followed . Stealing the stones , [I]1481-the little figure below suppose , was nothing to [you]146-flambeau . [You]146-flambeau could have done it by sleight of hand in a hundred other ways besides that pretence of putting a paper donkey 's tail to [Fischer]157-fischer 's coat . But in the rest [you]146-flambeau eclipsed [yourself]146-flambeau . "[1481-the little figure below]

[The silvery figure among the green leaves]1482-the silvery figure among the green leaves seems to linger as if hypnotised , though [his]1482-the silvery figure among the green leaves escape is easy behind [him]1482-the silvery figure among the green leaves ; [he]1482-the silvery figure among the green leaves is staring at [the man below]1483-the man below .

" Oh , yes , "[1483-the man below] says [the man below]1483-the man below , " [I]1483-the man below know all about it . [I]1483-the man below know [you]146-flambeau not only forced the pantomime , but put it to a double use . [You]146-flambeau were going to steal the stones quietly ; news came by [an accomplice]3852-an accomplice that [you]146-flambeau were already suspected , and [a capable police officer]3853-a capable police officer was coming to rout [you]146-flambeau up that very night . [A common thief]3854-a common thief would have been thankful for the warning and fled ; but [you]146-flambeau are [a poet]3855-a poet . [You]146-flambeau already had the clever notion of hiding the jewels in a blaze of false stage jewellery . [The worthy officer]3858-the worthy officer started from [Putney police station]3859-putney police station to find [you]146-flambeau , and walked into the queerest trap ever set in [this world]3860-this world . When the front door opened [he]3858-the worthy officer walked straight on to the stage of a Christmas pantomime , where [he]3858-the worthy officer could be kicked , clubbed , stunned and drugged by the dancing harlequin , amid roars of laughter from [all the most respectable people in [Putney]51-putney]3861-all the most respectable people in putney . Oh , [you]146-flambeau will never do anything better . And now , by the way , [you]146-flambeau might give [me]1483-the man below back those diamonds . "[1483-the man below]

The green branch on which the glittering figure swung , rustled as if in astonishment ; but the voice went on :

" [I]1485-the small man below want [you]146-flambeau to give them back , [Flambeau]146-flambeau , and [I]1485-the small man below want [you]146-flambeau to give up this life . There is still youth and honour and humour in [you]146-flambeau ; do n't fancy [they]3862-they will last in that trade . [Men]3431-men may keep a sort of level of good , but [no man]935-no man has ever been able to keep on one level of evil . [That road]3865-that road goes down and down . [The kind man]3866-the kind man drinks and turns cruel ; [the frank man]3867-the frank man kills and lies about it . [Many a man [I]1485-the small man below 've known]3868-many a man i 've known started like [you]146-flambeau to be [an honest outlaw]3869-an honest outlaw , [a merry robber of the rich]3870-a merry robber of the rich , and ended stamped into slime . [Maurice Blum]172-maurice blum started out as [an anarchist of principle]3871-an anarchist of principle , [a father of the poor]3872-a father of the poor ; [he]172-maurice blum ended [a greasy spy and tale - bearer that both sides]3873-a greasy spy and tale - bearer that both sides used and despised . [Harry Burke]173-harry burke started [his]173-harry burke free money movement sincerely enough ; now [he]173-harry burke 's sponging on [a half - starved sister]3874-a half - starved sister for endless brandies and sodas . [Lord Amber]174-lord amber went into wild society in a sort of chivalry ; now [he]174-lord amber 's paying blackmail to [the lowest vultures in [London]4-london]3875-the lowest vultures in london . [Captain Barillon]175-captain barillon was [the great gentleman]3876-the great gentleman - apache before [your]146-flambeau time ; [he]175-captain barillon died in [a madhouse]3877-a madhouse , screaming with fear of the "[1485-the small man below] narks " and receivers that had betrayed [him]175-captain barillon and hunted [him]175-captain barillon down . [I]1485-the small man below know [the woods]3878-the woods look very free behind [you]146-flambeau , [Flambeau]146-flambeau ; [I]1485-the small man below know that in a flash [you]146-flambeau could melt into them like a monkey . But some day [you]146-flambeau will be [an old grey monkey]3879-an old grey monkey , [Flambeau]146-flambeau . [You]146-flambeau will sit up in [[your]146-flambeau free forest]3880-your free forest cold at heart and close to death , and the tree - tops will be very bare . "[1485-the small man below]

Everything continued still , as if [the small man below]1485-the small man below held the other in the tree in some long invisible leash ; and [he]1485-the small man below went on :

" [Your]146-flambeau downward steps have begun . [You]146-flambeau used to boast of doing nothing mean , but [you]146-flambeau are doing something mean tonight . [You]146-flambeau are leaving suspicion on [an honest boy]3881-an honest boy with a good deal against [him]3881-an honest boy already ; [you]146-flambeau are separating [him]3881-an honest boy from [the woman [he]3881-an honest boy loves and who loves [him]3881-an honest boy]3882-the woman he loves and who loves him . But [you]146-flambeau will do meaner things than that before [you]146-flambeau die . "[1485-the small man below]

Three flashing diamonds fell from the tree to the turf . [The small man]1486-the small man stooped to pick them up , and when [he]1486-the small man looked up again the green cage of the tree was emptied of its silver bird .

The restoration of the gems accidentally picked up by [Father Brown]121-father brown , of [all people]1487-all people ended the evening in uproarious triumph ; and [Sir Leopold]157-fischer , in [his]157-fischer height of good humour , even told [the priest]374-the priest that though [he]157-fischer [himself]157-fischer had broader views , [he]157-fischer could respect those whose creed required [them]1489-them to be cloistered and ignorant of [this world]3860-this world .

[The Invisible Man]176-the invisible man

In the cool blue twilight of [two steep streets in [Camden Town]21-camden town]1491-two steep streets in camden town , [the shop at the corner , [a confectioner]1493-a confectioner 's]1492-the shop at the corner , a confectioner 's , glowed like the butt of a cigar . [One]412-one should rather say , perhaps , like the butt of a firework , for the light was of many colours and some complexity , broken up by many mirrors and dancing on many gilt and gaily - coloured cakes and sweetmeats . Against this one fiery glass were glued the noses of many gutter - snipes , for the chocolates were all wrapped in those red and gold and green metallic colours which are almost better than chocolate itself ; and the huge white wedding - cake in the window was somehow at once remote and satisfying , just as if the whole [North Pole]26-the north pole were good to eat . Such rainbow provocations could naturally collect [the youth of [the neighbourhood]1496-the neighbourhood]1495-the youth of the neighbourhood up to the ages of ten or twelve . But this corner was also attractive to [youth]1390-youth at a later stage ; and [a young man , not less than twenty - four]1498-a young man , not less than twenty - four , was staring into [the same shop]1499-the same shop window . To [him]1498-a young man , not less than twenty - four , also , [the shop]418-the shop was of fiery charm , but this attraction was not wholly to be explained by chocolates ; which , however , [he]1498-a young man , not less than twenty - four was far from despising .

[He]1498-a young man , not less than twenty - four was [a tall , burly , red - haired young man]1501-a tall , burly , red - haired young man , with a resolute face but a listless manner . [He]1498-a young man , not less than twenty - four carried under [his]1498-a young man , not less than twenty - four arm a flat , grey portfolio of black - and - white sketches , which [he]1498-a young man , not less than twenty - four had sold with more or less success to [publishers]1502-publishers ever since [[his]1498-a young man , not less than twenty - four uncle]1503-his uncle who was [an admiral]1504-an admiral had disinherited [him]1498-a young man , not less than twenty - four for Socialism , because of a lecture which [he]1498-a young man , not less than twenty - four had delivered against that economic theory . [His]1498-a young man , not less than twenty - four name was [John Turnbull Angus]177-john turnbull angus .

[His]1498-a young man , not less than twenty - four order was evidently a usual one . [The dark young lady]1515-the dark young lady had never taken [her]1515-the dark young lady dark eyes off [him]1498-a young man , not less than twenty - four , but seemed to be studying [him]1498-a young man , not less than twenty - four with almost tragic exactitude . " [The other fellow]3916-the other fellow was more silent and more ordinary ; but somehow [he]3916-the other fellow alarmed [me]315-the man much more than poor little [Smythe]182-smythe . [Angus]181-angus , who had hitherto maintained hilarious ease from motives of mental hygiene , revealed the strain of [his]181-angus soul by striding abruptly out of [the inner room]1511-the inner room and confronting [the new - comer]1533-the new - comer . " On the window ? "[1542-the staring angus] repeated [the staring Angus]1542-the staring angus .

" There 's no time to explain other things , "[1543-the small millionaire] said [the small millionaire]1543-the small millionaire shortly . " There 's some tomfoolery going on here that has to be investigated . "[1543-the small millionaire]

"[186-smythe]
